climbs.name: The Hearse
climbs.fa: Crux is around the first corner.

content.description: The Crux is around the first corner figuring out the hand holds is kind hard but once you get it it’s not to bad. The end has a crucial foot hold which I will show in pictures.
content.location: start on the far left of the boulder and traversed your way all the way to the right side. Top out on the farthest right peak of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on an undercling on the left side of the corner and your right on top of a large block opposite. Move directly up using finger pockets on the boulders surface, and mantle to finish.
content.location: On the far left side of the boulder, look for a good undercling on the corner

content.description: Start matching hands on a good sized hold about nipple height. feet on the ledge below. Climb directly upwards. Crux is a far reach to a flat sloper to top off. This route is a little easier the taller you are, but still can be done by a shorter climber.
content.protection: Crash pad. Walk off at top.
content.location: slightly left of the split between light and dark colored rock.

content.description: Sit start with you hands on the large Vertical rail, Into a good reach for a small left handhold on the face of the roof. Get Find the handholds above and work your way over the top. The large horizontal rail can be used instead of the vertical, but makes the climb closer to a V0, as the first move is easily the crux.
content.location: Far right side of the boulder, near the walk off
